page.title: 17Tumuli on South Downs Scarp
page.content: On the map of our twelve squares we noticed the words tumulus and tumuli. We checked in an encyclopaedia and discovered these were ancient burial mounds.We looked more closely at the map and noticed that there were ten tumuli in our squares and that they were all along the top edge of the Downs scarp,over-looking the valley. There was other evidence to show that early man had lived on the Downs.Just to the west of our squares,close to the South Downs Way was a 'settlement' and to the south an Anglo-Roman field system. We walked along the track from our school up to Black Cap to look for the tumuli,but we could not see many of those marked on the map.Our teacher told us that in the winter,after the harvest you can see the rectangular outlines of the field system.
